definitions: tool or device designed to divide something into separate parts or portions
examples: The wood splitter made quick work of the large logs
We need a cable splitter to connect multiple devices

definitions: goods or property taken forcibly from an enemy in warfare
examples: The soldiers divided the spoils of war among themselves
Pirates buried their spoils on the remote island

definitions: process of food or other materials becoming unfit for use through natural decay
examples: The grocery store calculated spoilage into their pricing model
Proper refrigeration helps prevent food spoilage during transport

definitions: aerodynamic device that disrupts airflow to reduce lift or increase downforce
person or thing that reveals important plot details of a story
examples: The car's rear spoiler improved its high-speed stability
He installed a custom spoiler on his sports car
Please don't share any spoilers about the movie ending
The review contained major spoilers for the final season

definitions: act or process of becoming damaged, rotten, or otherwise unusable
examples: The spoiling of meat happens faster in warm temperatures
They noticed signs of spoiling in the stored grain

definitions: rod or bar extending from the center of a wheel to its rim
examples: The bicycle wheel had several broken spokes that needed repair
Each spoke connects the hub to the outer rim

definitions: person who speaks officially on behalf of a group, organization, or cause
examples: The company spokesperson addressed the media about the merger
She served as the spokesperson for the environmental campaign

definitions: woman who speaks officially on behalf of a group, organization, or cause
examples: The spokeswoman clarified the government's position on the issue
They appointed a new spokeswoman for the charity organization

definitions: porous material or implement used for washing, cleaning, or absorbing liquids
simple aquatic animal with a porous body that filters water for food
examples: She used a sponge to clean the kitchen counter
The car wash attendant grabbed a large sponge
Divers discovered colorful sponges growing on the coral reef
Marine sponges have been harvested for centuries

definitions: act of providing funds or resources to support an event, activity, person, or organization
examples: The sports team secured corporate sponsorship for the season
Her sponsorship enabled the young athlete to train professionally

definitions: quality of being spontaneous, acting on natural impulse without planning or external stimulus
examples: Their relationship thrived on spontaneity and adventure
The performer's spontaneity delighted the audience every night

definitions: humorous imitation of something, typically a film or genre, in which its characteristic features are exaggerated
examples: The comedy show featured a spoof of popular action movies
They created a spoof advertisement that went viral online

definitions: supernatural being such as a ghost or phantom that causes fear
informal term for a spy or intelligence agent
examples: Children dressed as spooks for the Halloween party
The old house was rumored to have spooks in the attic
The retired spook wrote a memoir about intelligence work
Government spooks monitored the suspicious communications

definitions: cylinder or reel on which thread, wire, film, or other flexible materials are wound
examples: She needed a new spool of thread for her sewing machine
The fishing line came on a large plastic spool

definitions: utensil with a shallow bowl-shaped container and a handle, used for eating or serving
examples: He stirred his coffee with a small silver spoon
The baby learned to eat with a spoon

definitions: amount that a spoon can hold, used as a rough measure
examples: Add two spoonfuls of sugar to the mixture
The recipe calls for a spoonful of vanilla extract

definitions: tiny reproductive cell capable of developing into a new organism without sexual fusion
examples: Mushrooms release millions of spores into the air
The fern's spores were visible under the microscope

definitions: person who broadcasts descriptions and commentary of sporting events on television or radio
examples: The sportscaster provided exciting play-by-play commentary
She became a famous sportscaster after years of local broadcasting

definitions: man who engages in sports, especially professionally
person who exhibits qualities valued in sports such as fairness and grace
examples: The sportsman trained daily for the upcoming competition
He was recognized as sportsman of the year
Despite losing, he remained a true sportsman throughout
The sportsman congratulated his opponent warmly

definitions: ethical and appropriate behavior while participating in sports, including fairness, respect, and graciousness
examples: The coach emphasized sportsmanship over winning at all costs
Her display of sportsmanship earned respect from opponents

definitions: clothing designed to be worn for sports or physical exercise
examples: The store specializes in high-quality sportswear for runners
She changed into comfortable sportswear before the gym

definitions: woman who engages in sports, especially at a professional or competitive level
examples: The sportswoman broke several records during her career
Young sportswomen looked up to her as a role model

definitions: journalist who writes about sports and sporting events for newspapers, magazines, or websites
examples: The sportswriter covered the championship game in detail
Local sportswriters voted for the player of the year

definitions: powerful light directed onto a particular area or person
intense public attention or scrutiny focused on someone or something
examples: The spotlight illuminated the lead actor on stage
Technicians adjusted the spotlight for the performance
The scandal put the company in the media spotlight
She enjoyed her moment in the spotlight after winning

definitions: person who observes and identifies things or assists someone during physical exercise
examples: The weightlifter always uses a spotter for heavy lifts
Wildlife spotters helped researchers track rare birds

definitions: action of detecting, identifying, or observing something
appearance of small marks or light bleeding
examples: Bird spotting requires patience and good binoculars
The spotting of enemy aircraft saved many lives
She noticed some spotting on the fabric
Light spotting can occur between menstrual periods

definitions: projecting tube or lip through which liquid can be poured from a container
examples: The teapot's spout was decorated with delicate patterns
Water flowed freely from the fountain's spout

definitions: injury to a ligament caused by excessive stretching or tearing
examples: The basketball player suffered a sprain during the game
Her ankle sprain required several weeks of recovery

definitions: uncontrolled expansion of urban areas into surrounding regions
examples: Urban sprawl threatened the surrounding farmland
The city's sprawl extended for miles in every direction

definitions: act or state of spreading out over a large area in an untidy or irregular way
examples: The sprawling of suburbs changed the landscape dramatically
Developers were concerned about the sprawling of the city

definitions: liquid dispersed in fine droplets or particles in the air
device or container that dispenses liquid in a fine mist
examples: Ocean spray refreshed the beachgoers on hot days
The gardener applied pesticide spray to the plants
She bought a new spray for cleaning windows
The paint spray made the job much easier

definitions: act of dispersing liquid in fine droplets over an area or surface
examples: The spraying of crops must be done carefully
Regular spraying kept the garden free of pests

definitions: device or tool used to distribute material evenly over an area
examples: The fertilizer spreader covered the lawn efficiently
They used a salt spreader on icy roads

definitions: act of extending something over a wider area or to more people
examples: The spreading of information happened rapidly online
Scientists studied the spreading of the disease

definitions: computer program that organizes data in rows and columns for calculations and analysis
examples: She created a budget using a spreadsheet program
The accountant updated the financial spreadsheet daily

definitions: period of unrestrained activity or indulgence in a particular activity
examples: They went on a shopping spree during the sales
The crime spree lasted several weeks before arrests

definitions: small stem bearing leaves or flowers, taken from a plant or bush
examples: She garnished the dish with a sprig of parsley
The florist added a sprig of baby's breath

definitions: flexible board used for diving or gymnastics to gain extra height
something that provides an opportunity for further development or progress
examples: The diver bounced on the springboard before diving
Gymnasts practiced their routines using the springboard
Her internship served as a springboard to a successful career
The startup used initial funding as a springboard for growth

definitions: part of an arch or structure from which an arch springs or begins
examples: The architect examined the stone springer of the bridge
Medieval builders carefully positioned each springer

definitions: season of spring, typically associated with growth, renewal, and warming weather
examples: Flowers bloom beautifully during springtime
Many animals give birth in the springtime

definitions: light shower or small quantity of something scattered over an area
examples: A sprinkle of rain didn't stop the outdoor event
She added a sprinkle of cinnamon to the coffee

definitions: device that sprays water, especially for watering lawns or extinguishing fires
examples: The lawn sprinkler ran every morning at dawn
Fire sprinklers activated when smoke was detected

definitions: act of scattering drops or particles of something over a surface
examples: A sprinkling of sugar topped the fresh donuts
The sprinkling of holy water blessed the congregation

definitions: short race run at full speed or period of running at top speed
examples: The hundred-meter sprint determined the fastest runner
She finished with a powerful sprint to the finish line

definitions: athlete who specializes in short-distance races requiring maximum speed
examples: The sprinter won gold in three different events
Professional sprinters train for explosive speed

definitions: small supernatural being or fairy, typically portrayed as mischievous and delicate
examples: Forest sprites danced in the moonlight according to legend
The story featured a water sprite who granted wishes
